definition: to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: When his headaches developed Nick became bad- tempered and even violent.
sentences.chinese: 尼克出现头痛时脾气就变得很差，甚至还会动粗。

sentences.english: A twelve-year-old girl would go to war for Rometra.
sentences.chinese: 一个12岁的女孩曾对Rometra动粗。

sentences.english: She studied me warily, as if I might turn violent.
sentences.chinese: 她警惕地看着我，似乎担心我会动粗。

sentences.english: They want you to shake the shit out of them till you hear the cops coming.
sentences.chinese: 她想逼你动粗，一直到警察来为止。

sentences.english: Teacher to manage children with poor management on the use of brute force, people are really very teeth.
sentences.chinese: 老师管理孩子管理不好就动粗，真的是让人很不齿的。

sentences.english: Etc. , the somebody didn't resort to violence, opposed, directly carry breakfast to go to bed.
sentences.chinese: 等了等，某人竟然没动粗，相反，直接把早点端上床。

definition: to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
to square off/to exchange blows/to rain blows on sb
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to thump repeatedly with one's fist
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
